content.question: ​Which of the following is the inverse of the function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals 4 log subscript 2 open parentheses x plus 3 close parentheses minus 1"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 1 fourth open parentheses 2 to the power of x plus 1 close parentheses minus 3"><semantics><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mfenced><mrow><msup><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 1 fourth times 2 to the power of open parentheses x plus 1 close parentheses end exponent minus 3"><semantics><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 2 to the power of open parentheses x over 4 plus 1 close parentheses end exponent minus 3"><semantics><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 2 to the power of open parentheses fraction numerator x plus 1 over denominator 4 end fraction close parentheses end exponent minus 3"><semantics><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mfenced></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 2 to the power of open parentheses fraction numerator x plus 1 over denominator 4 end fraction close parentheses end exponent minus 3"><semantics><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mfenced><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mfenced></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 2.13: Exponential and Logarithmic Equations and Inequalities

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
